content.raw:
I'm struggling to get heightmap textures to work in gazebo. The problem I am having is illustrated in the attached image. Basically, the heightmap loads, but no textures are shown. I'm working from the stock heightmap.world packaged as part of gazebo-1.9.2. I've packaged the terrain into a model "location_terrain", which is defined below. All the resources are found correctly by the simulator and no error messages are returned.

```
#!xml

<?xml version="1.0"?>
<sdf version="1.4">
  <model name="location_terrain">
    <static>true</static>
    
    <link name="link">

      <collision name="collision">
        <geometry>
          <heightmap>
            <uri>model://location_terrain/materials/textures/terrain.png</uri>
            <size>129 129 10</size>
            <pos>0 0 0</pos>
          </heightmap>
        </geometry>
      </collision>

      <visual name="visual">
        <geometry>
          <heightmap>
            <texture>
              <diffuse>model://location_terrain/materials/textures/dirt_diffusespecular.png</diffuse>
              <normal>model://location_terrain/materials/textures/dirt_normal.png</normal>
              <size>1</size>
            </texture>
            <texture>
              <diffuse>model://location_terrain/materials/textures/grass_diffusespecular.png</diffuse>
              <normal>model://location_terrain/materials/textures/grass_normal.png</normal>
              <size>1</size>
            </texture>
            <texture>
              <diffuse>model://location_terrain/materials/textures/fungus_diffusespecular.png</diffuse>
              <normal>model://location_terrain/materials/textures/fungus_normal.png</normal>
              <size>1</size>
            </texture>
            <blend>
              <min_height>2</min_height>
              <fade_dist>5</fade_dist>
            </blend>
            <blend>
              <min_height>4</min_height>
              <fade_dist>5</fade_dist>
            </blend>
            <uri>model://location_terrain/materials/textures/terrain.png</uri>
            <size>129 129 10</size>
            <pos>0 0 0</pos>
            <use_terrain_paging>0</use_terrain_paging>
          </heightmap>
        </geometry>
      </visual>

    </link>
  </model>
</sdf>
```

Here is my world file...

```
#!xml
<?xml version="1.0"?>
<sdf version="1.4">
  <world name="example">

    <scene>
      <sky>
        <clouds>
          <speed>12</speed>
        </clouds>
      </sky>
    </scene>

	<include>
	  <uri>model://sun</uri>
	</include>

	<include>
	  <uri>model://location_terrain</uri>
	</include>

  </world>

</sdf>

```

I am working on a Lenovo Yoga 13" running Ubuntu 13.10. Here is the output of glxinfo, in case its a direct rending issue.


content.html:
I'm struggling to get heightmap textures to work in gazebo. The problem I am having is illustrated in the attached image. Basically, the heightmap loads, but no textures are shown. I'm working from the stock heightmap.world packaged as part of gazebo-1.9.2. I've packaged the terrain into a model "location_terrain", which is defined below. All the resources are found correctly by the simulator and no error messages are returned.

<?xml version="1.0"?>
<sdf version="1.4">
  <model name="location_terrain">
    <static>true</static>

    <link name="link">

      <collision name="collision">
        <geometry>
          <heightmap>
            <uri>model://location_terrain/materials/textures/terrain.png</uri>
            <size>129 129 10</size>
            <pos>0 0 0</pos>
          </heightmap>
        </geometry>
      </collision>

      <visual name="visual">
        <geometry>
          <heightmap>
            <texture>
              <diffuse>model://location_terrain/materials/textures/dirt_diffusespecular.png</diffuse>
              <normal>model://location_terrain/materials/textures/dirt_normal.png</normal>
              <size>1</size>
            </texture>
            <texture>
              <diffuse>model://location_terrain/materials/textures/grass_diffusespecular.png</diffuse>
              <normal>model://location_terrain/materials/textures/grass_normal.png</normal>
              <size>1</size>
            </texture>
            <texture>
              <diffuse>model://location_terrain/materials/textures/fungus_diffusespecular.png</diffuse>
              <normal>model://location_terrain/materials/textures/fungus_normal.png</normal>
              <size>1</size>
            </texture>
            <blend>
              <min_height>2</min_height>
              <fade_dist>5</fade_dist>
            </blend>
            <blend>
              <min_height>4</min_height>
              <fade_dist>5</fade_dist>
            </blend>
            <uri>model://location_terrain/materials/textures/terrain.png</uri>
            <size>129 129 10</size>
            <pos>0 0 0</pos>
            <use_terrain_paging>0</use_terrain_paging>
          </heightmap>
        </geometry>
      </visual>

    </link>
  </model>
</sdf>

Here is my world file...

<?xml version="1.0"?>
<sdf version="1.4">
  <world name="example">

    <scene>
      <sky>
        <clouds>
          <speed>12</speed>
        </clouds>
      </sky>
    </scene>

    <include>
      <uri>model://sun</uri>
    </include>

    <include>
      <uri>model://location_terrain</uri>
    </include>

  </world>

</sdf>

I am working on a Lenovo Yoga 13" running Ubuntu 13.10. Here is the output of glxinfo, in case its a direct rending issue.
